intro: Micropera utriculosa var. diwata, commonly known as the Japanese bladderwort, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It is characterized by its small, bladder-like structures that trap small aquatic organisms. The plant typically grows in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds and marshes. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it has a short blooming period in the spring. The species is part of the family Lentibulariaceae, which includes other carnivorous plants.
